document.docAuthor: Sutthinun, Chanaporn, Gattolliat, Jean-Luc & Boonsoong, Boonsatien
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Platybaetis Müller-Liebenau, 1980 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from Thailand, with description of the imago of Platybaetis bishopi Müller-Liebenau, 1980

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Platybaetis Müller-Liebenau, 1980 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from Thailand, with description of the imago of Platybaetis bishopi Müller-Liebenau, 1980

, B. Boonsoong leg. (ZMKU): 16 L.

Larva. ( Figs. 5–10 ) See Müller-Liebenau (1980a) . EXcept shape of the labrum with a shallow indentation in the middle of fore margin in the original description ( Müller-Liebenau 1980a , Fig. 1a ), while labrum of our specimens with a more straight margin and more eXpanded laterally ( Fig. 5 ). Claw with one row of ca 8–9 teeth increasing in size towards apeX ( Fig. 26 ), in contrast to the figure in the original description, where two most apical teeth are drawn as much bigger than others ( Müller-Liebenau 1980a , Fig. 2b ).
Head. Whitish; scape and pedicel apeX dark brown, flagellum medium brown to colourless. Facetted surface of turbinate eyes orange, lateral face reddish apically.

ThoraX. Light brown, with a few small diffusive yellowish striped on median suture. Pronotum with a pair of black stripes. Anteronotal protuberance flattened and not prominent. All legs pale whitish. Foreleg femora with brownish macula; middle and hind legs femora with oval shaped brownish mark; tarsi blackish. Proportions of forelegs: tibia 1.6 of femur length; tarsus shorter than tibia. Proportions of middle and hind legs: tibia 1.3–1.4 of femur length; tarsus 2.5 times shorter than tibia. Forewing ( Figs. 11 , 15 ) with a dark brown and orange base; longitudinal veins colorless eXtensively bordered with dark brown in proXimal fourth; other parts of membrane colorless; cross-veins thickened and blackish. Two marginal intercalaries in every space between main veins, equal or slightly longer than distance between surrounding veins; pterostigma with 4–5 oblique cross-veins. Hindwing absent.
Head. Yellowish. Antenna with scape and pedicel medium to dark brown, flagellum medium brown to ecru.

ThoraX. Similar to male imago eXcept greyish, with a few diffusive blackish maculae on medioscutum. Foreleg femora with large, diffusive, brownish macula; middle and hind legs femora with oval shaped brownish marked. Proportions of forelegs: tibia 1.2 of femur length; tarsus shorter than tibia. Proportions of middle and hind legs: tibia 1.2 of femur length; tarsus 2.6–3.0 times shorter than tibia. Tarsus of middle and hind legs with 2 apical spines (on 1st+2nd and on 3rd tarsomeres). Forewing as in male eXcept diffusive, blackish macula stretched from stigmatic area to apeX.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 5–10.
P. bishopi Müller-Liebenau, 1980
, larva. (5) labrum, ventral view; (6) canine and molar area of left mandible, dorsal view; (7) canine and molar area of right mandible, dorsal view; (8) labium, ventral view (arrow = clavate bristle); (9) tergum IV–VI; (10) distal margin of tergite V. Scale = 100 µm.

FIGURES 11–14. Male imago (11) and female imago (12) of
P. bishopi Müller-Liebenau, 1980
(Ratchaburi province), dorsal view; male imago (13) and female imago (14) of
P. nayokensis
sp. nov.
(Nakhon Nayok province), dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen. Abdominal terga and sterna greyish brown. Terga III, IV, VI and VII with pair of dark brown stripes on each side; tergum V with thin stripes nearly absent; tergum VIII with no marks; tergum IX with or without a group of brownish points medially. ApeX of sternum IX yellowish, with deep V-shape median insertion. Cerci colourless.
